pr_title: Add option to run integration tests with Jaeger

timeline.message:
Add option to run integration tests with Jaeger.

Signed-off-by: Carsten Lohmann <carsten.lohmann@bosch.io>

timeline.bodyText: can we rename this to jaeger.enabled? I find it much easier to understand boolean properties that are expressed in their original positive semantics ...
timeline.author: sophokles73
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -58,6 +58,9 @@ Test cases are run against Docker images of Hono server + (Apache Qpid Dispatch
     <!-- logging profile: either prod, dev or trace -->
     <logging.profile>prod</logging.profile>
     <trace.frames>0</trace.frames>
+    <jaeger.disabled>true</jaeger.disabled>

replies.bodyText: That was my initial approach. However that would require quite some gymnastics to invert the value for the <skip> field in the Jaeger docker image run configuration. I think that is not worth the effort, especially since the jaeger.disabled field is not supposed to be set on the command line. Instead the jaeger maven profile should be used.
replies.author: calohmn
